publications.title: Generation of two induced pluripotent stem cell lines from a patient with recessive inherited retinal disease caused by compound heterozygous mutations in SNRNP200 gene

donor.disease_description: Patient with recessive inherited retinal disease (retinitis pigmentosa/rod-cone dystrophy) carrying compound heterozygous SNRNP200 variants c.1792C>T and c.3341T>C

genomic_modifications.description: Compound heterozygous endogenous variants in SNRNP200 (c.1792C>T and c.3341T>C) present in the donor and maintained in the iPSC line
genomic_modifications.genotype: Compound heterozygous for SNRNP200 c.1792C>T and c.3341T>C

genomic_characterisation.summary: Normal diploid karyotype (46,XX) with no reprogramming-induced genomic alterations detected by SNP-array/CNV analysis.

induced_derivation.non_int_vector_name: Episomal plasmids containing OCT4, SOX2, KLF4, L-MYC, LIN28, shRNA for p53 and miR-302/367

ethics.institutional_HREC: University of Western Australia Human Research Ethics Committee
Sir Charles Gairdner Hospital Human Research Ethics Committee
